basics.name: Peng Kuang
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate in Computer Science
basics.summary: Final-year Ph.D. student in Computer Science at Lund University, specializing in software development, eye tracking and machine learning.

work.name: Lund University
work.summary: Research in the intersection of software engineering, eye tracking and machine learning.
highlights: Agile Software Development (Java 8, Linux/Bash)
Software Testing (Java)
Systems Development for Large Systems (Java & JS)
Object-Oriented Modeling and Design (Java)
Database Technology (SQL, Java)

work.name: ETH Zurich
work.summary: Visiting the PEACH lab in the Department of Computer Science.
highlights: Hosted by Professor April Wang
Conducted experiments with 40 novice programmer participants

work.name: GIIIT (GUANGDONG TECHNION - ISRAEL INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY)
work.summary: Worked as an software developer in the university IT department.
highlights: Managed ERP system implementation and monitoring (Oracle & Java)
Student Life cycle Management system (SLcM) research and evaluation
Integration of the printing system PaperCut with payment service providers, e.g., Alipay.
Migration of the open-source asset management system SnipeIT.
Support for the open-source online learning system Moodle.

work.name: LEADON
work.summary: Led the operations team to manage the mobile application publishing, marketing and monetization.
highlights: Formulated and tested the monetization strategy for sustainable revenue

work.name: APPCOOL
work.summary: Co-founded a company focused on quantum computing.
highlights: Developed programming languages and tools
Brain-computer interaction research

work.name: GAMELOFT
highlights: Implemented monetization tools and strategies
Brain-computer interaction research

work.name: ZYNGA
work.summary: Worked on machine learning operations and VAI software.
highlights: Developed and maintained machine learning models
Implemented VAI software solutions

work.name: LINEKONG INTERACTIVE
work.summary: Managed product marketing and operations for multile game titles.

work.name: UNIVERSITY OF MELBOURNE
work.summary: Worked on the research website rebuild project.
highlights: Tested new versions of the Research Hub website
Maintained/updated web pages for the project
Assisted in other areas such as data analysis, workflow automation and project management

work.name: UNIVERSITY OF MELBOURNE
work.summary: Worked as a research assistant for Prof. Shanton Chang.
highlights: Research about the health-seeking behavior of a small, marginalized cohort of international students in Australia.
Secured a partnership with a leading social app for participant recruitment.

work.name: UNIVERSITY OF MELBOURNE
work.summary: Worked as the president and office bearer of the graduate student association.
highlights: Led the council to govern the operations of the organization including strategic planning, financial management, risk management, and policies and procedures development.

work.name: PSYCHPRESS
highlights: Implemented mobile-friendly login and sign-up features
fixed around 5 bugs (3 database querying and 2 loading speed optimization) for existing web applications

volunteer.summary: Assisting with creating content and managing publicity channels for the conference.
Organizing the program committee, finding reviewer and communicating the results with the authors.

volunteer.organization: The 2023 Psychology of Programming Interest Group (PPIG) Workshop

publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 8th International Conference on the Art Science and Engineering of Programming

projects.name: Adaptive Developer Tools (ADAPT2)
projects.summary: Research project focused on developer tools adapted to the developer needs and the software development workflow.

projects.name: Gaze in Code Review (Gander)
projects.summary: Research project focused on building a gaze-driven code review platform.
